meanings.definition: A person or thing that erects or constructs something.
meanings.sent1: The erectors built the new house in just a few weeks.
meanings.sent2: The erectors used their tools to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The erectors were so skilled that they could build a tower out of playing cards.
meanings.sent4: The erectors of the bridge worked tirelessly to connect the two sides of the river.
meanings.sent5: The erectors' teamwork and precision ensured the successful completion of the project.

meanings.definition: A muscle that straightens or raises a body part.
meanings.sent1: His erectors helped him stand up straight after sitting for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The erectors in his back were sore from lifting heavy boxes all day.
meanings.sent3: The erectors in his legs were like springs, propelling him forward with each step.
meanings.sent4: Her erectors tensed as she prepared to lift the weight above her head.
meanings.sent5: The erectors in his neck strained as he tried to look up at the tall building.

meanings.definition: A type of crane used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The erectors lifted the steel beams effortlessly with the crane.
meanings.sent2: The erectors carefully maneuvered the crane to place the heavy load in position.
meanings.sent3: The erectors joked that the crane was their giant metal arm helping them reach new heights.
meanings.sent4: The erectors controlled the crane with precision, like puppeteers guiding a marionette.
meanings.sent5: The erectors relied on the crane to hoist the materials to the top of the building.
